The contrast between the Church of the Apostles and the Ecclesia moderna appears nowhere so powerfully asin the Opus Evangelicum. lt is in the form of a lively trialogus, Wyclis using for the first two books the commentaries of Chrysostom and Augustin, those of Chry· sostorn and Jerome for the following books. His copyists understood it to take that form, and wrote in the margin, where the quotations from Chrysostom and¹ the other Fathers occurred: chrysostomus, Hieronymus el Joannes. But Wyclis himself would not bave presumed thus to set his own words on a level with those of the channels (fistulae) of the Holy Ghost.
